text: Daniel Hayward (1807 – 29 May 1852) was an English professional cricketer who played first-class cricket from 1832 to 1851.Booth & Booth 2018, p.7. He was the father of Cambridge batsmen Thomas Hayward and Daniel Hayward junior; and the grandfather of Tom Hayward, the Surrey and England opener.Booth & Booth 2018, p.1. A right-handed batsman and wicket-keeper who was mainly associated with Cambridge Town Club, Hayward made 24 known appearances in first-class matches.CricketArchive. Retrieved on 4 December 2008. He represented the Players in the Gentlemen v Players series and the North in the North v. South series. He is buried in the Mill Road cemetery, Cambridge, as is his son Thomas Hayward. ==References== ==Bibliography== * Category:1807 births Category:1852 deaths Category:English cricketers Category:English cricketers of 1826 to 1863 Category:Cambridge Town Club cricketers Category:Players cricketers Category:North v South cricketers Category:Surrey cricketers Category:Marylebone Cricket Club cricketers Category:United South of England Eleven cricketers Category:Cambridgeshire and Yorkshire cricketers
title: Daniel Hayward
